channel.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
channel.description:
[center]This is a direct quote from SRL, from SRL forums i thought i would post here.[/center]
[size=24pt]SRL - Announcement.[/size]
Runescape is in serious trouble. Free-2-Play is threatened in its existence. Botting is once again seriously destroying the game at an alarming rate. While some may think Jagex deserves it, SRL believes this to be a big mistake. Botting on such a massive scale is stupid, provocative and frankly quite dangerous since it quashes the very basis of our own existence. It is on this light SRL is reaching out a helping hand to Jagex by releasing BotCatcher. BotCatcher reports level-3 and level-4 's.
Why do we do this?
[ul][li]SRL has been and will always be respectful towards Jagex. We try to be a leech-free community and demand input and creativity from our Members. We feel that recent events will ultimately lead to the destruction of f2p runescape. Unless we do something, we will all end up empty handed, for at this rate of botting, runescape will be gone pretty soon.[/li] [li]Someone out there is selling runescape bot-liscences. His only goal is to make money. He doesn't care at all for the game nor the underlying social and economical structure nor for the shear pleasure it gives to 100.000 mainly young players worldwide. And though RS has its dark sides, it is still a wonderful elaborate game, free for all. Destroying a free game is unethical and immoral.[/li] [li]We want to make crystal clear we have nothing to do with any of these botting activities. While this has once destroyed Kaitnieks, it wont destroy us![/li] [li]Of course we are all aware that releasing this script is a controversial act, but it is not an act of war nor hostility but one of Reason. Point well made, stop destroying the game. Be creative, there are many way of cloaking your existence.[/li] [/ul]
Help runescape survive. Run Botcatcher.

item.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

If this only reports level 3’s and 4’s without asking any questions, or any other method of finding autoers, then there are better chances who ever is using the script to report players will be the one getting banned (for misuse of the Report Abuse).

So bear that in mind, please. Lol.

~Dizzy

Read full topic

item.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
item.dc:creator: @scubaspaz scubaspaz
item.description:
@scubaspaz wrote:

[quote=“Starblaster100, post:14, topic:83742”]Well there’s a difference in looking over your mates shoulder and copying a few answers, compared to standing up, raping the teacher, stealing everyone else’s papers, comparing all of their answers just to make sure you have the right answer and then copying it down ;)[/quote] I agreee (very funny lol still laughing) seriously if u want to be a noob and cheat your way through runescape thats just wrong. now if u just need to make some money and u dont have the time its fine (in a cheating sort of way) cuz we experianced cheaters that actually played the game legit but got bored and stuff are being overrun by immature 10 year olds that dont have a life =D. trying to be nice but this is a very wierd topic

also hers a direct quote from SRL

Of course we are all aware that releasing this script is a controversial act, but it is not an act of war nor hostility but one of Reason. Point well made, stop destroying the game. Be creative, there are many way of cloaking your existence.

Read full topic

item.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Starblaster100, post:12, topic:83742”]You should run this script around the Yew trees, where there are about 20 level 3’s, all in default clothes, cutting down the trees with bronze and iron axes.

While we cheat on one character at a time using SCAR, users of RSDemon are autoing on 20 chars at a time and are completely destroying that game.

Prices will drop drastically for all items, and F2P Runescape will be completely taken over by RSDemon Abusers. This, in turn, will then heavily affect P2P players, and RS will completely die.

These autoers are actually destroying the game, and we at SRL feel that cheating should have a limit on it.

Thats why WT-Fakawi has created this script.

Yes it is a little controversial that we are cheaters and we are reporting other cheaters.
Yes it is a little controversial that it is a macro which is doing the reporting, but we feel this has to be done.

There are 2 types of cheaters, and the longer you are with the cmmunities, the more you realise that

If you agree with us, then help us out!
Go to popular bot spots and run the script.

Together, we can save RS and carry on cheating the ‘good’ way

Thanks

Star[/quote]
Explain to me how there’s a “Good” way to “Cheating”
I might just cheat on my tests the “Good” way.

<3 Star.

Read full topic

You should run this script around the Yew trees, where there are about 20 level 3’s, all in default clothes, cutting down the trees with bronze and iron axes.

While we cheat on one character at a time using SCAR, users of RSDemon are autoing on 20 chars at a time and are completely destroying that game.

Prices will drop drastically for all items, and F2P Runescape will be completely taken over by RSDemon Abusers. This, in turn, will then heavily affect P2P players, and RS will completely die.

These autoers are actually destroying the game, and we at SRL feel that cheating should have a limit on it.

Thats why WT-Fakawi has created this script.

Yes it is a little controversial that we are cheaters and we are reporting other cheaters.
Yes it is a little controversial that it is a macro which is doing the reporting, but we feel this has to be done.

There are 2 types of cheaters, and the longer you are with the cmmunities, the more you realise that

If you agree with us, then help us out!

Read full topic

item.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“Se7eN, post:9, topic:83742”]how does this script know if the people are not just normal people doing their normal thing at level 1-6 i mean while it is not likely i have seen lvl 3’s that are human respond to unique questions and correct gramatical mistake i purposly stick in my sentances to throw bots off. so after further inspection of this script it just reports most every lvl 3-6 in common skill area’s. this is an uneffective way of doing things and may just get alot of honest players banned for not working on their combat lvl’s

-Se7eN[/quote]

i belive it sees ifthey move

very wierd…

Read full topic

item.title: BotCatcher-SRL Forums Direct
item.dc:creator: @Se7eN Se7eN
item.description:
@Se7eN wrote:

how does this script know if the people are not just normal people doing their normal thing at level 1-6 i mean while it is not likely i have seen lvl 3’s that are human, respond to unique questions, and correct gramatical mistakes i purposly stick in my sentances to throw bots off. so after further inspection of this script it just reports most every lvl 3-6 in common skill area’s (or whereever you are when this script is run for that matter****). this is an uneffective way of doing things and may just get alot of honest players banned for not working on their combat lvl’s

****note: The script doesn’t check anything but where the white dots that represent people are on the minimap other than that it couldn’t care less about where you are. and because jagex will most likely be like " whoa there are huge amounts of macroing reports comming in. and at first it will check most of them but after a while it will understand that it is a bot banning bots so i will no longer check or weed out the normal people caught in the cross fire. also the possibility for the asshat who runs this a lumby castle or lumby chicken fields etc. and gets a whole lote of honest 10yr olds banned is huge and mortifing if you are using the “good for runescape” argument. just a thought…

-Se7eN

ps. so as not to confuse anyone, i hate lvl 3 autoers just as much as the next bloke but i don’t want to see innocents caught in the cross fire.

Read full topic
